# ğŸ¨ Your First HyperCode "Click Moment"
# When neurodivergent developers think "Finally, a language that gets me!"

ğŸ” @verifiable("formal_proof")
ğŸ“ @ensures("output.shape == (batch, classes)")
ğŸ“‹ @requires("input.shape[1] == features")
ğŸ§  @intent("Classify input features into categories")
ğŸ¯ @accessibility("high_contrast", "dyslexia_font", "reduced_cognitive_load")
function simple_classifier(input: Tensor[batch, features]) -> Tensor[batch, classes] {
    # ğŸ¨ Every operation is visually clear
    ğŸ¨ weights = initialize(features, classes)

    # âš¡ Fast operations are marked
    âš¡ logits = matmul(input, weights)

    # ğŸ”„ Return values are obvious
    ğŸ”„ return softmax(logits)
}

# ğŸ§  Compare this to traditional code:
# def simple_classifier(input):
#     weights = torch.nn.Linear(features, classes)
#     logits = weights(input)
#     return torch.softmax(logits, dim=-1)

# ğŸ¯ The difference:
# - No more guessing what functions do (@ğŸ§  intent)
# - No more anxiety about correctness (@ğŸ” verifiable)
# - No more squinting at symbols (emoji markers)
# - No more cognitive overload (clear visual structure)

# ğŸŒŸ THIS is the click moment!
